alert.note: Alert for Glasscock; Howard; Mitchell; Reagan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 16 at 5:26AM CDT until September 16 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Glasscock County in western Texas... Mitchell County in western Texas... Northeastern Reagan County in western Texas... Southern Howard County in western Texas... * Until 615 AM CDT. * At 525 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Lake Colorado City State Park to 12 miles southeast of Greenwood, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Lomax Mesonet reported a wind gust of 74 MPH at 512 AM CDT. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Garden City, Coahoma, Forsan, Sand Springs, Lomax, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Champion Creek Reservoir, Westbrook, Big Spring Country Club, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark, Saint Lawrence, and Elbow. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 181 and 211. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
